column4: Younger populations might be more inclined to migrate for better opportunities.
column5: Positive net migration rates indicate regions where more people are moving in than out, which could attract further migration due to perceived opportunities.
column6: Regions with higher average incomes may attract migrants seeking better standards of living and economic opportunities.
column7: Higher GDP growth rates often correlate with better economic opportunities, attracting migrants seeking employment and higher living standards.
column11: Immigration policy score: More open immigration policies might attract migrants seeking refuge or better economic opportunities.
column12: Conflict index: Regions experiencing conflicts or geopolitical tensions may see increased migration due to safety concerns or displacement.
column16: Rapid urbanization might lead to increased demand for labor and services, attracting migrants to urban centers.
column19: Regions with diverse populations may be more welcoming to migrants from different backgrounds.
